me.taylorkelly.mywarp.util.i18n

Class FolderSourcedControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.ResourceBundle.Control
      • me.taylorkelly.mywarp.util.i18n.FolderSourcedControl

  • public class FolderSourcedControl
extends java.util.ResourceBundle.Control
    Searches for PropertyResourceBundles in a folder, before trying to resolve them from the classpath.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.util.ResourceBundle.Control

        FORMAT_CLASS, FORMAT_DEFAULT, FORMAT_PROPERTIES, TTL_DONT_CACHE, TTL_NO_EXPIRATION_CONTROL

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FolderSourcedControl(java.nio.charset.Charset encoding, java.io.File folder)
      Creates an instance that tries to load bundles from the given folder before falling back to the classpath.
      FolderSourcedControl(java.io.File folder)
      Creates an instance that tries to load bundles from the given folder before falling back to the classpath.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FolderSourcedControl

        public FolderSourcedControl(java.io.File folder)
        Creates an instance that tries to load bundles from the given folder before falling back to the classpath. Bundles are read with an UTF-8 encoding.
        Parameters:
        folder - the folder to load from

      • FolderSourcedControl

        public FolderSourcedControl(java.nio.charset.Charset encoding,
                            java.io.File folder)
        Creates an instance that tries to load bundles from the given folder before falling back to the classpath. Bundles are read with the given encoding.
        Parameters:
        folder - the folder to load from
        encoding - the encoding to use

      • readResource

        @Nullable
protected java.io.InputStream readResource(java.lang.String resourceName,
                                                     java.lang.ClassLoader loader,
                                                     boolean reload)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Creates an InputStream for the resource of the given resourceName using the given loader to load it. May return null if the resource could not be loaded.
        Parameters:
        resourceName - the name of the resource
        loader - the loader
        reload - whether the resource is expired and should be reloaded from disk
        Returns:
        an InputStream for the resource
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a I/O error occurs
